source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-826
Reason: 3-Phenylpropansäure has a melting point influenced by the functional groups in the molecule relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of three phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +60°C.
